Action Class¶

class action.Action(comm)[source]¶

Provides an interface between desired movement and the Robot. Accepts a communication object to write to.

Attributes:

Debug Setting True enables verbose output of commands. MOTOR_ANGLES The angles of our wheels relative to the x-axis.

These begin from front-left and move anticlockwise.
MOTORS Trigonometric calculations for each motor, used for
holonomic movement
Debug = False¶
MOTORS = [(-0.8660254037844387, 0.49999999999999994), (-1.8369701987210297e-16, -1.0), (0.8660254037844387, 0.49999999999999994)]¶
MOTOR_ANGLES = [2.6179938779914944, 4.71238898038469, 0.5235987755982988]¶
angle = 0.5235987755982988¶
catch(scale=100)[source]¶

Sends the catch command to the robot. Performns no checking of the catcher’s position prior to catching.

Parameters:scale – Power scale for this catch. Range [0,100]. Default 100.
kick(scale=100)[source]¶

Sends the kick command to the robot. Performs no checking of the kicker’s state prior to kicking.

Parameters:scale – Power scale for this kick. Range [0,100]. Default 100.
move(angle, scale)[source]¶

Moves the robot in the given angle with given scale as power value.

Parameters:
  • angle – The direction of movement, in radians, relative to x-axis of robot
  • scale – Power-scale for this movement, range: -1 to 1
open_catcher(scale=100)[source]¶

Sends the command to open the catcher to the robot. Currently implemented simply as a kick.

Parameters:scale – Power scale for the catch. Range [0,100]. Default 100.
ping()[source]¶

Sends the PING command to the Robot. Robot should return “PONG” via the serial connection if correctly functioning.

stop()[source]¶

Stops the robot’s movement by setting all motors to zero.

turn(speed)[source]¶

Turn the robot with the given power.

Parameters:speed – The speed of the turn, range is [-100,100]. Positive values result in clockwise rotation, negative in anticlockwise.
